title: Getting Started with dmft
text: dmft package implements Age-Spatial-Temporal (AST) model estimating projecting dental caries burden (DMFT/dmft indices) subnational level. uses two-stage approach: Stage 1: random intercept mixed-effects model via lme4 (optionally Stan Bayesian backend). Stage 2: AST kernel smoothing residuals across space, time, age dimensions using Kronecker-product weight matrices. tutorial walks full analysis pipeline using synthetic (phantom) data.

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: experimental Bayesian backend, also install cmdstanr:
code: # Install from GitHub pak::pak("choxos/dmft") install.packages("cmdstanr",                   repos = c("https://stan-dev.r-universe.dev", getOption("repos"))) cmdstanr::install_cmdstan()

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: Every analysis begins dmft_config(), defines regions, time period, age groups, model parameters. Key parameters: regions: Character vector subnational region names. must match data shapefile. region_col: column name data containing region names. year_range: Historical period c(start, end). projection_range: Future projection period (optional). ast_params: Smoothing parameters AST kernel (see Model Details ). n_boot: Number bootstrap replicates uncertainty intervals. covariates: Optional fixed-effect covariates (column names data).
code: library(dmft)  cfg <- dmft_config(   regions = c("Region_A", "Region_B", "Region_C",               "Region_D", "Region_E"),   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(2000, 2020),   projection_range = c(2021, 2030),   age_groups_deciduous = c("0-4", "5-9", "10-14"),   age_groups_permanent = c("5-9", "10-14", "15-19", "20-24",                            "25-29", "30-34", "35-39", "40-44",                            "45-49", "50-54", "55-59", "60+"),   ast_params = list(     par_space = 0.9,     par_time = 2,     par_age = 1,     weight_coverage = 0.9   ),   n_boot = 200,   seed = 42 )  cfg #> ℹ DMFT analysis configuration #>   Regions:      5 (Region_A, Region_B, Region_C, ...) #>   Historical:   2000-2020 (21 years) #>   Projections:  2021-2030 #>   Age groups:   deciduous=3, permanent=12 #>   AST params:   space=0.9, time=2, age=1 #>   Covariates:   none #>   Bootstrap:    200 replicates #>   Seed:         42

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: demonstration, generate synthetic data. practice, load CSV/XLSX dmft_load(). phantom data mimics realistic study-level data known age--region patterns, temporal trend, random missingness.
code: phantom <- dmft_phantom(cfg, dentition = "permanent", n_per_cell = 2) #> ✔ Generated 2142 phantom records head(phantom) #>                         study province year age_start age_end    sex   n #> 1   phantom_Region_A_2000_5-9 Region_A 2000         5       9 Female  73 #> 2   phantom_Region_A_2000_5-9 Region_A 2000         5       9   Male  69 #> 3 phantom_Region_A_2000_10-14 Region_A 2000        10      14   Male 332 #> 4 phantom_Region_A_2000_10-14 Region_A 2000        10      14 Female 261 #> 5 phantom_Region_A_2000_20-24 Region_A 2000        20      24 Female  73 #> 6 phantom_Region_A_2000_20-24 Region_A 2000        20      24   Male 185 #>   mean_DMFT sd_DMFT #> 1      1.50    0.98 #> 2      0.58    1.26 #> 3      3.03    1.95 #> 4      3.44    1.69 #> 5      8.25    2.55 #> 6      9.49    2.83

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: data minimum:
code: # From CSV raw <- dmft_load("path/to/your_data.csv", config = cfg)  # From Excel raw <- dmft_load("path/to/your_data.xlsx", config = cfg)

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: dmft_clean() performs column standardization, region name mapping, age group assignment, outlier flagging, uncertainty imputation. result list $deciduous $permanent tibbles. standardized columns including se_imputed inverse-variance weighting.
code: clean <- dmft_clean(phantom, config = cfg) #> ✔ Cleaned: 360 deciduous, 2142 permanent records names(clean) #> [1] "deciduous" "permanent" str(clean$permanent[, c("region_std", "year", "age_group", "mean_DMFT",                          "se_imputed", "se_source")]) #> tibble [2,142 × 6] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ region_std: chr [1:2142] "Region_A" "Region_A" "Region_A" "Region_A" ... #>  $ year      : num [1:2142] 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 ... #>  $ age_group : chr [1:2142] "5-9" "5-9" "10-14" "10-14" ... #>  $ mean_DMFT : num [1:2142] 1.5 0.58 3.03 3.44 8.25 ... #>  $ se_imputed: num [1:2142] 0.115 0.152 0.107 0.105 0.298 ... #>  $ se_source : chr [1:2142] "from_sd_n" "from_sd_n" "from_sd_n" "from_sd_n" ...

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: package uses hierarchical strategy ensure every observation standard error: Use SE reported directly Compute SE SD sample size Compute SE confidence intervals Estimate SD default coefficient variation (CV), compute SE can control default CV via cv_default dmft_config().

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: dmft_adjacency() builds neighbourhood graph shapefile. Since using phantom data without real shapefile, construct simple adjacency manually: real shapefiles, function handles Queen contiguity, island detection, automatic region name matching.
code: # For real data, use: # adj <- dmft_adjacency(shapefile_path = "regions.shp", config = cfg)  # For phantom data, create a mock adjacency adj_matrix <- matrix(0, 5, 5) rownames(adj_matrix) <- colnames(adj_matrix) <- cfg$regions # Chain topology: A-B-C-D-E adj_matrix[1,2] <- adj_matrix[2,1] <- 1 adj_matrix[2,3] <- adj_matrix[3,2] <- 1 adj_matrix[3,4] <- adj_matrix[4,3] <- 1 adj_matrix[4,5] <- adj_matrix[5,4] <- 1  # Build spdep neighbourhood nb <- list() for (i in 1:5) nb[[i]] <- as.integer(which(adj_matrix[i,] == 1)) class(nb) <- "nb" attr(nb, "region.id") <- cfg$regions  adj <- list(   adj_matrix   = adj_matrix,   nb           = nb,   sf           = NULL,   location_ids = setNames(1:5, cfg$regions) )

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: dmft_fit() runs Stage 1 AST methodology: random intercept mixed-effects model via lme4::lmer(). model formula : inverse-variance weights se_imputed.
code: fit <- dmft_fit(   data      = clean$permanent,   adjacency = adj,   dentition = "permanent",   config    = cfg ) #> ℹ Model data: 2142 obs, 5 regions, years 2000-2020 #> ℹ Fitting lme4 model (permanent): y ~ 1 + (1 | region_std) + (1 | year_factor) #> ✔ lme4 fit complete in 1s (AIC=14788.8, BIC=14811.4) y ~ 1 + [covariates] + (1|region_std) + (1|year_factor)

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: include fixed-effect covariates:
code: cfg_cov <- dmft_config(   regions = cfg$regions,   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(2000, 2020),   covariates = c("fluoridation_pct", "sugar_consumption") )

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: dmft_predict() applies Stage 2 (AST kernel smoothing) computes bootstrap uncertainty intervals. result tibble one row per region-year-age_group cell: predicted: AST-smoothed point estimate lower, upper: 95% bootstrap confidence intervals
code: estimates <- dmft_predict(fit, adj, config = cfg, n_boot = 100) #> ℹ Computing bootstrap uncertainty (100 replicates)... #> ✔ Predictions: 1260 cells (permanent) head(estimates) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   region    year age_group predicted lower upper #>   <chr>    <int> <chr>         <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 Region_A  2000 10-14          3.47  1.38  5.55 #> 2 Region_A  2000 15-19          5.34  1.47  5.73 #> 3 Region_A  2000 20-24          7.29  2.00  5.52 #> 4 Region_A  2000 25-29          9.32  1.62  5.53 #> 5 Region_A  2000 30-34         11.3   1.95  5.83 #> 6 Region_A  2000 35-39         13.5   1.23  6.03

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: Residuals Stage 1 smoothed using three kernel weight matrices: Spatial: Adjacency-based weights parameter par_space (default 0.9). Self-weight high; adjacent regions get moderate weight; non-adjacent get zero. Temporal: LOESS-style cubic power weights parameter par_time (default 2). Nearby years get high weight, distant years get low weight. Age: Exponential decay parameter par_age (default 1). Adjacent age groups get high weight, distant groups get low weight. combined weight matrix Kronecker product: W = kronecker(space_mat, kronecker(age_mat, time_mat)), row-normalized sum 1.

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: dmft_diagnose() computes fit statistics, residual diagnostics, spatial autocorrelation tests, prediction validity checks. Key diagnostic outputs: non-significant Moran’s (p > 0.05) suggests AST smoothing adequately captured spatial structure.
code:
diag <- dmft_diagnose(fit, config = cfg) #> Warning in deviance.merMod(fit): deviance() is deprecated for REML fits; use #> REMLcrit for the REML criterion or deviance(.,REML=FALSE) for deviance #> calculated at the REML fit #> ℹ Diagnostics (PERMANENT) #>   AIC=14788.8  BIC=14811.4 #>   RMSE=9.500  MAE=7.589  Bias=6.8087 #>   Var(year_factor): 0.1139 (SD=0.3374) #>   Var(region_std): 0.0838 (SD=0.2894) #>   Var(Residual): 0.8671 (SD=0.9312) #>   Moran's I: stat=-1.1351, p=0.2563 (OK) #>   Predictions: range [2.97, 4.34], 0<0, 0>28 # Fit statistics diag$fit_stats #>     metric     value #> 1      AIC 14788.758 #> 2      BIC 14811.436 #> 3   logLik -7390.379 #> 4 deviance 14780.758  # Variance components diag$variance_components #>         group   variance        sd #> 1 year_factor 0.11386961 0.3374457 #> 2  region_std 0.08377718 0.2894429 #> 3    Residual 0.86708501 0.9311740  # Residual metrics cat(sprintf("RMSE: %.3f
MAE:  %.3f
Bias: %.4f
",             diag$residuals$rmse, diag$residuals$mae, diag$residuals$bias)) #> RMSE: 9.500 #> MAE:  7.589 #> Bias: 6.8087  # Spatial autocorrelation (Moran's I) if (!is.na(diag$spatial$p.value)) {   cat(sprintf("Moran's I: %.4f (p = %.4f)
",               diag$spatial$statistic, diag$spatial$p.value)) } #> Moran's I: -1.1351 (p = 0.2563)

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: dmft_project() extrapolates temporal trends three scenarios: Reference: continuation observed trend Optimistic: accelerated improvement (default: -0.02/year adjustment) Pessimistic: slower improvement (default: +0.02/year adjustment) trend estimated last 10 years year random effects, damping (default 0.95 per year) prevent unrealistic extrapolation.
code: projections <- dmft_project(fit, estimates, config = cfg) #> ✔ Projected 10 years across 3 scenarios head(projections) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>    year scenario  mean_proj lower upper #>   <int> <chr>         <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1  2021 Reference      3.46  1.63  5.29 #> 2  2022 Reference      3.44  1.61  5.26 #> 3  2023 Reference      3.41  1.59  5.24 #> 4  2024 Reference      3.39  1.57  5.22 #> 5  2025 Reference      3.38  1.55  5.21 #> 6  2026 Reference      3.36  1.53  5.19

title: Getting Started with dmft
code: dmft_plot_trends(estimates, projections)

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: real shapefile:
code: dmft_plot_map(estimates, adj$sf, year = 2020)

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: convenience, dmft_run() orchestrates steps single call:
code: results <- dmft_run(   data_path      = "my_data.csv",   shapefile_path = "my_regions.shp",   config         = cfg,   dentition      = "permanent" )  # Access results results$estimates$permanent results$diagnostics$permanent results$projections$permanent

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: Bayesian backend uses Stan (via cmdstanr) Stage 1 instead lme4. provides posterior credible intervals instead bootstrap intervals.

title: Getting Started with dmft
code: install.packages("cmdstanr",                   repos = c("https://stan-dev.r-universe.dev", getOption("repos"))) cmdstanr::install_cmdstan()

title: Getting Started with dmft
code: # Fit with Stan fit_b <- dmft_fit_bayes(   data      = clean$permanent,   adjacency = adj,   dentition = "permanent",   config    = cfg )  # AST smoothing + posterior credible intervals estimates_b <- dmft_predict_bayes(fit_b, adj, config = cfg)  # Bayesian diagnostics (Rhat, ESS, LOO-CV) diag_b <- dmft_diagnose_bayes(fit_b, config = cfg)  # Projections using posterior draws proj_b <- dmft_project_bayes(fit_b, estimates_b, config = cfg)

title: Getting Started with dmft
code: results_b <- dmft_run(   data_path      = "my_data.csv",   shapefile_path = "my_regions.shp",   config         = cfg,   backend        = "bayesian" )

title: Getting Started with dmft
code: cfg_bayes <- dmft_config(   regions = c("Region_A", "Region_B", "Region_C"),   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(2000, 2020),   stan_settings = list(     chains        = 4,     iter_warmup   = 1000,     iter_sampling = 1000,     adapt_delta   = 0.95,     max_treedepth = 12   ) )

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: Bayesian diagnostics include: Rhat: < 1.01 parameters ESS (bulk tail): > 400 Divergences: 0 LOO-CV: Leave-one-cross-validation via loo::loo() Posterior predictive checks: Coverage observed data posterior predictive intervals Variance decomposition: posterior draws sigma parameters

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: model observation ii: yi∼Normal(μi,σ2+sei2)y_i \sim \text{Normal}(\mu_i, \sigma^2 + \text{se}_i^2) μi=β0+Xiβ+bregion[]+byear[]\mu_i = \beta_0 + X_i\beta + b_{\text{region}[]} + b_{\text{year}[]} bregion∼Normal(0,σregion2)b_{\text{region}} \sim \text{Normal}(0, \sigma_{\text{region}}^2) byear∼Normal(0,σyear2)b_{\text{year}} \sim \text{Normal}(0, \sigma_{\text{year}}^2) sei\text{se}_i known (imputed) standard error study, providing inverse-variance weighting.

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: Residuals ri=yi−ŷir_i = y_i - \hat{y}_i smoothed using: r̂,t,s=∑′,t′,s′Wa,′⋅Wt,t′⋅Ws,s′⋅ra′,t′,s′\hat{r}_{,t,s} = \sum_{',t',s'} W_{,'} \cdot W_{t,t'} \cdot W_{s,s'} \cdot r_{',t',s'} weight matrices : Spatial: WS(,j)=ρW_S(,j) = \rho =ji=j, ρ(1−ρ)\rho(1-\rho) adjacent, 0 otherwise Temporal: WT(,j)=(1−(|−j|/T)λ)3W_T(,j) = (1 - (|-j|/T)^\lambda)^3 (LOESS cubic power) Age: WA(,j)=exp(−ω|−j|)W_A(,j) = \exp(-\omega|-j|) (exponential decay) combined weight matrix : W=WS⊗WA⊗WTW = W_S \otimes W_A \otimes W_T (Kronecker product), row-normalized. Final estimates: ŷ,t,s=μ̂,t,s+r̂,t,s\hat{y}_{,t,s} = \hat{\mu}_{,t,s} + \hat{r}_{,t,s}

title: Getting Started with dmft
text: Shoaee S, et al. (2022). Subnational estimation dental caries burden. BMC Oral Health, 22:634. Shoaee S, et al. (2025). Subnational estimation using AST models. BMC Oral Health, 25:1490. Foreman KJ, et al. (2012). Modeling causes death: integrated approach using CODEm. Population Health Metrics, 10:1.

title: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: dmft implements Age-Spatial-Temporal (AST) model estimating projecting dental caries burden (DMFT/dmft indices) subnational level country. Documentation & Tutorial: https://choxos.github.io/dmft/

title: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: Two-stage AST modeling: mixed-effects model + kernel-smoothed residuals across age, space, time Two backends: frequentist (lme4, default) Bayesian (cmdstanr, experimental) Spatial smoothing via adjacency-based weight matrices shapefiles Temporal smoothing using LOESS-inspired cubic power weights Age smoothing exponential decay kernels Uncertainty quantification: bootstrap (frequentist) posterior credible intervals (Bayesian) Projection framework reference, optimistic, pessimistic scenarios Publication-ready visualizations: choropleth maps, temporal trends, uncertainty ribbons Country-agnostic: works shapefile study-level data

title: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: experimental Bayesian backend, also install cmdstanr:
code: # Install from GitHub pak::pak("choxos/dmft")  # Or with remotes remotes::install_github("choxos/dmft") install.packages("cmdstanr", repos = c("https://stan-dev.r-universe.dev", getOption("repos"))) cmdstanr::install_cmdstan()

title: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: See full tutorial complete walkthrough.
code: library(dmft)  # 1. Configure the analysis for your country cfg <- dmft_config(   regions = c("Region_A", "Region_B", "Region_C", "Region_D"),   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(2000, 2020),   projection_range = c(2021, 2030) )  # 2. Run the full pipeline results <- dmft_run(   data_path = "my_data.csv",   shapefile_path = "my_regions.shp",   config = cfg )  # 3. Visualize dmft_plot_map(results$estimates$permanent, results$adjacency$sf, year = 2020) dmft_plot_trends(results$estimates$permanent, results$projections$permanent)

title: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
code: # Load and clean data raw <- dmft_load("data.csv", config = cfg) clean <- dmft_clean(raw, config = cfg)  # Create spatial structure adj <- dmft_adjacency(shapefile_path = "regions.shp", config = cfg)  # Fit mixed-effects model (frequentist) fit <- dmft_fit(clean$permanent, adj, dentition = "permanent", config = cfg)  # AST smoothing + bootstrap uncertainty estimates <- dmft_predict(fit, adj, config = cfg)  # Diagnostics diagnostics <- dmft_diagnose(fit, config = cfg)  # Project future trends projections <- dmft_project(fit, estimates, config = cfg)

title: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
code: # Fit with Stan instead of lme4 fit_b <- dmft_fit_bayes(clean$permanent, adj, dentition = "permanent", config = cfg)  # Predictions with posterior credible intervals estimates_b <- dmft_predict_bayes(fit_b, adj, config = cfg)  # Bayesian diagnostics (Rhat, ESS, LOO-CV) diag_b <- dmft_diagnose_bayes(fit_b, config = cfg)  # Or run the full pipeline with backend = "bayesian" results <- dmft_run("data.csv", "regions.shp", config = cfg, backend = "bayesian")

title: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: input CSV/XLSX contain study-level summary statistics minimum:

title: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: package uses two-stage AST (Age-Spatial-Temporal) approach following Shoaee et al. (2022, 2025): Stage 1 — Mixed-effects model frequentist backend estimates parameters via REML (lme4). Bayesian backend uses HMC/NUTS sampling (Stan) weakly informative priors. Stage 2 — AST kernel smoothing residuals Residuals Stage 1 smoothed using weighted averaging across three dimensions: Spatial: adjacency-based weights (par_space = 0.9) Temporal: LOESS cubic power decay (par_time = 2) Age: exponential decay (par_age = 1) combined weight matrix Kronecker product three weight matrices, row-normalized sum 1.
code: y_i ~ Normal(mu_i, sigma^2 + se_i^2)  mu_i = beta_0 + [covariates] + b_region + b_year  b_region ~ Normal(0, sigma_region^2)   [random intercepts] b_year   ~ Normal(0, sigma_year^2)     [random intercepts]

title: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: Shoaee S, et al. (2022). Subnational estimation dental caries burden. BMC Oral Health, 22:634. Shoaee S, et al. (2025). Subnational estimation using AST models. BMC Oral Health, 25:1490.

what: Apply AST smoothing to residuals — apply_ast_smoothing
title: Apply AST smoothing to residuals — apply_ast_smoothing
text: Core algorithm: combines spatial, temporal, age weight matrices via Kronecker products, applies coverage weighting, normalizes, computes weighted average residuals prediction cell.

title: Apply AST smoothing to residuals — apply_ast_smoothing
code: apply_ast_smoothing(   resid_df,   space_mat,   time_mat,   age_mat,   n_age,   min_year,   max_year,   weight_coverage = 0.9 )

title: Apply AST smoothing to residuals — apply_ast_smoothing
text: resid_df Data frame columns: age, year, location, residual, optionally coverage. space_mat Spatial weight matrix. time_mat Temporal weight matrix. age_mat Age weight matrix. n_age Number age groups. min_year Start year. max_year End year. weight_coverage Coverage weight parameter (default 0.9).

title: Apply AST smoothing to residuals — apply_ast_smoothing
text: Data frame columns: year, age, location, residual_AST.

what: Calculate age weight matrix for AST — calc_age_matrix
title: Calculate age weight matrix for AST — calc_age_matrix
text: Exponential decay: W_A(,j) = 1 / exp(omega * |-j|)

title: Calculate age weight matrix for AST — calc_age_matrix
code: calc_age_matrix(n_age, par_age = 1)

title: Calculate age weight matrix for AST — calc_age_matrix
text: n_age Number age groups. par_age Age smoothing parameter (omega, default 1).

title: Calculate age weight matrix for AST — calc_age_matrix
text: Square age weight matrix.

what: Calculate spatial weight matrix for AST — calc_space_matrix
title: Calculate spatial weight matrix for AST — calc_space_matrix
text: Transforms binary adjacency matrix spatial weights. Diagonal = par_space, adjacent cells = par_space * (1 - par_space), non-adjacent = 0.

title: Calculate spatial weight matrix for AST — calc_space_matrix
code: calc_space_matrix(adj_matrix, par_space = 0.9)

title: Calculate spatial weight matrix for AST — calc_space_matrix
text: adj_matrix Binary adjacency matrix (0/1). par_space Spatial correlation parameter (default 0.9).

title: Calculate spatial weight matrix for AST — calc_space_matrix
text: Square spatial weight matrix.

what: Calculate temporal weight matrix for AST — calc_time_matrix
title: Calculate temporal weight matrix for AST — calc_time_matrix
text: LOESS-style cubic power weighting: W_T(,j) = (1 - (|-j|/T)^lambda)^3

title: Calculate temporal weight matrix for AST — calc_time_matrix
code: calc_time_matrix(min_year, max_year, par_time = 2)

title: Calculate temporal weight matrix for AST — calc_time_matrix
text: min_year Start year. max_year End year. par_time Temporal smoothing parameter (lambda, default 2).

title: Calculate temporal weight matrix for AST — calc_time_matrix
text: Square temporal weight matrix.

what: dmft: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries — dmft-package
title: dmft: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries — dmft-package
text: Implements Age-Spatial-Temporal (AST) models estimating dental caries burden (DMFT/dmft indices) subnational level. Uses two-stage approach: (1) random intercept mixed-effects model via lme4 (Stan experimental Bayesian backend), (2) AST kernel-smoothing residuals across space, time, age dimensions.

title: dmft: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries — dmft-package
text: main workflow functions : dmft_config(): Set analysis parameters dmft_load(): Load study-level data dmft_clean(): Clean standardize data dmft_adjacency(): Build spatial adjacency shapefile dmft_fit(): Fit mixed-effects model (frequentist) dmft_predict(): AST smoothing + bootstrap uncertainty dmft_diagnose(): Model diagnostics dmft_project(): Future trend projections dmft_run(): Full pipeline one call Bayesian alternatives (experimental): dmft_fit_bayes(), dmft_predict_bayes(), dmft_diagnose_bayes(), dmft_project_bayes().

title: dmft: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries — dmft-package
text: Shoaee S, et al. (2022). Subnational estimation dental caries burden. BMC Oral Health, 22:634. Shoaee S, et al. (2025). Subnational estimation using AST models. BMC Oral Health, 25:1490.

title: dmft: Age-Spatial-Temporal Modeling of Dental Caries — dmft-package
text: Maintainer: Ahmad Sofi-Mahmudi ahmad.sofimahmudi@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

what: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency
title: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency
text: Builds neighbourhood graph needed AST spatial weighting. Uses Queen contiguity (shared boundary vertex). Isolated regions (islands) connected nearest neighbour.

title: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency
code: dmft_adjacency(   shapefile_path = NULL,   sf_obj = NULL,   region_name_col = NULL,   config )

title: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency
text: shapefile_path Path shapefile (.shp). sf_obj Alternatively, sf object already memory. Exactly one shapefile_path sf_obj must provided. region_name_col Column shapefile containing region names. NULL, function tries detect automatically. config dmft_config object. Region ordering adjacency matrix match config$regions.

title: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency
text: list elements: adj_matrix Binary adjacency matrix (n x n). nb spdep neighbourhood object. sf sf object (reordered match config). location_ids Named integer vector mapping region names numeric IDs.

title: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ adj <- dmft_adjacency(shapefile_path = "provinces.shp", config = cfg) } # }

what: Apply AST (Age-Spatial-Temporal) smoothing to model residuals — dmft_ast
title: Apply AST (Age-Spatial-Temporal) smoothing to model residuals — dmft_ast
text: Implements AST kernel-smoothing algorithm following Foreman et al. (2012) CRAN AST package methodology. Residuals mixed-effects model smoothed across three dimensions (space, time, age) using kernel weights, added back predictions.

title: Apply AST (Age-Spatial-Temporal) smoothing to model residuals — dmft_ast
code: dmft_ast(fit, adjacency, config, dentition = c("deciduous", "permanent"))

title: Apply AST (Age-Spatial-Temporal) smoothing to model residuals — dmft_ast
text: fit fitted model dmft_fit() (lme4) dmft_fit_bayes() (Bayesian). supported transparently. adjacency Adjacency object dmft_adjacency(). config dmft_config object. dentition "deciduous" "permanent".

title: Apply AST (Age-Spatial-Temporal) smoothing to model residuals — dmft_ast
text: list elements: estimates Tibble columns: region, year, age_group, predicted, residual_ast. space_matrix Spatial weight matrix. time_matrix Temporal weight matrix. age_matrix Age weight matrix.

what: Clean and standardize DMFT data — dmft_clean
title: Clean and standardize DMFT data — dmft_clean
text: Performs column standardization, region name mapping, sex standardization, age group assignment, outlier flagging, value validation. Returns separate deciduous permanent datasets ready modeling.

title: Clean and standardize DMFT data — dmft_clean
code: dmft_clean(data, config)

title: Clean and standardize DMFT data — dmft_clean
text: data data frame dmft_load(). config dmft_config object.

title: Clean and standardize DMFT data — dmft_clean
text: list elements deciduous permanent, tibble standardized columns imputed uncertainty.

what: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
title: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
text: Defines parameters DMFT/dmft analysis: regions, time period, age groups, AST smoothing parameters, projection settings.

title: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
code: dmft_config(   regions,   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(1990, 2025),   projection_range = NULL,   age_groups_deciduous = c("0-4", "5-9", "10-14"),   age_groups_permanent = c("5-9", "10-14", "15-19", "20-24", "25-29", "30-34", "35-39",     "40-44", "45-49", "50-54", "55-59", "60+"),   dmft_max_deciduous = 20L,   dmft_max_permanent = 28L,   cv_default = 0.3,   covariates = NULL,   ast_params = list(par_space = 0.9, par_time = 2, par_age = 1, weight_coverage = 0.9),   n_boot = 1000L,   stan_settings = NULL,   seed = 12345L,   region_mapping = NULL )

title: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
text: regions Character vector region names (e.g., provinces). region_col Column name data containing region names. year_range Length-2 integer vector c(start, end) historical period. projection_range Optional length-2 vector c(start, end) projections. NULL, projections configured. age_groups_deciduous Character vector deciduous age group labels. age_groups_permanent Character vector permanent age group labels. dmft_max_deciduous Maximum biologically plausible dmft (default 20). dmft_max_permanent Maximum biologically plausible DMFT (default 28). cv_default Default coefficient variation uncertainty imputation. covariates Character vector covariate column names include fixed effects mixed model. NULL, intercept used. ast_params Named list AST smoothing parameters: par_space Spatial correlation parameter (default 0.9). par_time Temporal smoothing parameter, lambda (default 2). par_age Age smoothing parameter, omega (default 1). weight_coverage Weight high-coverage data sources (default 0.9). n_boot Number bootstrap replicates uncertainty intervals. stan_settings Optional named list Stan sampling settings experimental Bayesian backend (see dmft_fit_bayes()). Elements: chains, iter_warmup, iter_sampling, adapt_delta, max_treedepth. NULL, sensible defaults used. seed Random seed reproducibility. region_mapping Optional named list mapping alternative region names canonical names regions.

title: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
text: object class "dmft_config".

title: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
code: cfg <- dmft_config(   regions = c("Region_A", "Region_B", "Region_C"),   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(2000, 2020) ) cfg #> ℹ DMFT analysis configuration #>   Regions:      3 (Region_A, Region_B, Region_C, ...) #>   Historical:   2000-2020 (21 years) #>   Age groups:   deciduous=3, permanent=12 #>   AST params:   space=0.9, time=2, age=1 #>   Covariates:   none #>   Bootstrap:    1000 replicates #>   Seed:         12345

title: Run model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose
text: Computes fit statistics (AIC, BIC), residual diagnostics (RMSE, MAE), spatial autocorrelation residuals (Moran's ), variance components.

title: Run model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose
code: dmft_diagnose(fit, config)

title: Run model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose
text: fit fitted model dmft_fit(). config dmft_config object.

title: Run model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose
text: list elements: fit_stats, residuals, spatial, variance_components, validity.

title: Run Bayesian model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose_bayes
text: Computes MCMC diagnostics (Rhat, ESS, divergences), model comparison statistics (LOO-CV via PSIS), posterior predictive checks, variance component summaries, spatial autocorrelation posterior mean residuals.

title: Run Bayesian model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose_bayes
code: dmft_diagnose_bayes(fit_bayes, config)

title: Run Bayesian model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose_bayes
text: fit_bayes fitted Bayesian model dmft_fit_bayes(). config dmft_config object.

title: Run Bayesian model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose_bayes
text: list elements: mcmc, fit_stats, variance_components, residuals, spatial, validity.

what: Fit a random intercept mixed-effects model for DMFT/dmft — dmft_fit
title: Fit a random intercept mixed-effects model for DMFT/dmft — dmft_fit
text: Stage 1 AST methodology: fits random intercept mixed-effects model via lme4::lmer() optional fixed covariates random province/year intercepts. Inverse-variance weighting applied standard errors available.

title: Fit a random intercept mixed-effects model for DMFT/dmft — dmft_fit
code: dmft_fit(data, adjacency, dentition = c("deciduous", "permanent"), config)

title: Fit a random intercept mixed-effects model for DMFT/dmft — dmft_fit
text: data data frame (one dentition subsets dmft_clean()). adjacency Adjacency object dmft_adjacency(). dentition "deciduous" "permanent". config dmft_config object.

title: Fit a random intercept mixed-effects model for DMFT/dmft — dmft_fit
text: fitted lme4 model object metadata attributes.

what: Fit a Bayesian random intercept model for DMFT/dmft via cmdstanr — dmft_fit_bayes
title: Fit a Bayesian random intercept model for DMFT/dmft via cmdstanr — dmft_fit_bayes
text: Experimental Bayesian alternative dmft_fit(). Uses random intercept structure (y ~ 1 + covariates + (1|region) + (1|year)) estimates parameters via Hamiltonian Monte Carlo (Stan) rather REML. AST smoothing (Stage 2) applied downstream via dmft_predict_bayes().

title: Fit a Bayesian random intercept model for DMFT/dmft via cmdstanr — dmft_fit_bayes
code: dmft_fit_bayes(   data,   adjacency,   dentition = c("deciduous", "permanent"),   config,   stan_settings = NULL )

title: Fit a Bayesian random intercept model for DMFT/dmft via cmdstanr — dmft_fit_bayes
text: data data frame (one dentition subsets dmft_clean()). adjacency Adjacency object dmft_adjacency(). dentition "deciduous" "permanent". config dmft_config object. stan_settings Named list overriding default Stan sampling settings: chains, iter_warmup, iter_sampling, adapt_delta, max_treedepth. NULL, uses defaults config built-defaults.

title: Fit a Bayesian random intercept model for DMFT/dmft via cmdstanr — dmft_fit_bayes
text: list class "dmft_fit_bayes" elements fit (CmdStanMCMC), mdata (prepared model data), config, dentition.

title: Load DMFT study-level data — dmft_load
text: Reads CSV Excel file containing study-level DMFT/dmft data. file minimum: region column, year, age_start, age_end, least one mean_dmft mean_DMFT.

title: Load DMFT study-level data — dmft_load
code: dmft_load(file_path, config)

title: Load DMFT study-level data — dmft_load
text: file_path Path CSV XLSX file. config dmft_config object (used identify region column).

title: Load DMFT study-level data — dmft_load
text: tibble raw data.

title: Load DMFT study-level data — dmft_load
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ cfg <- dmft_config(regions = c("A", "B"), region_col = "province",                    year_range = c(2000, 2020)) dat <- dmft_load("my_data.csv", config = cfg) } # }

what: Load a shapefile for spatial analysis — dmft_load_shapefile
title: Load a shapefile for spatial analysis — dmft_load_shapefile
text: Load shapefile spatial analysis

title: Load a shapefile for spatial analysis — dmft_load_shapefile
code: dmft_load_shapefile(shapefile_path)

title: Load a shapefile for spatial analysis — dmft_load_shapefile
text: shapefile_path Path .shp file (format sf::st_read() supports).

title: Load a shapefile for spatial analysis — dmft_load_shapefile
text: sf object.

what: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
title: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
text: Creates realistic test data following known age--region patterns, useful validating analysis pipeline using real data.

title: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
code: dmft_phantom(   config,   dentition = c("both", "deciduous", "permanent"),   n_per_cell = 1L,   temporal_trend = -0.015,   missing_prob = 0.15 )

title: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
text: config dmft_config object. dentition "deciduous", "permanent", "". n_per_cell Number synthetic studies per region-year-age cell. temporal_trend Annual proportional change (negative = improvement). missing_prob Probability cell missing (sparse data).

title: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
text: tibble synthetic study-level data.

title: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
code: cfg <- dmft_config(   regions = c("A", "B", "C"),   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(2000, 2020) ) phantom <- dmft_phantom(cfg, dentition = "permanent") #> ✔ Generated 645 phantom records head(phantom) #>                  study province year age_start age_end    sex   n mean_DMFT #> 1   phantom_A_2000_5-9        A 2000         5       9 Female 142      0.80 #> 2 phantom_A_2000_15-19        A 2000        15      19   Both 152      4.57 #> 3 phantom_A_2000_20-24        A 2000        20      24 Female 335      7.21 #> 4 phantom_A_2000_25-29        A 2000        25      29 Female 308      6.80 #> 5 phantom_A_2000_30-34        A 2000        30      34   Both  65      8.66 #> 6 phantom_A_2000_35-39        A 2000        35      39   Both 410     11.54 #>   sd_DMFT #> 1    0.64 #> 2    1.71 #> 3    2.91 #> 4    3.48 #> 5    3.59 #> 6    4.55

what: Plot a choropleth map of DMFT estimates — dmft_plot_map
title: Plot a choropleth map of DMFT estimates — dmft_plot_map
text: Plot choropleth map DMFT estimates

title: Plot a choropleth map of DMFT estimates — dmft_plot_map
code: dmft_plot_map(   estimates,   sf_obj,   year,   region_name_col = NULL,   value_col = "predicted",   title = NULL )

title: Plot a choropleth map of DMFT estimates — dmft_plot_map
text: estimates Predictions dmft_predict(). sf_obj sf object region boundaries. year Year display (estimates averaged across age groups). region_name_col Column sf_obj matching estimates$region. value_col Column map (default "predicted"). title Optional plot title.

title: Plot a choropleth map of DMFT estimates — dmft_plot_map
text: ggplot2::ggplot object.

what: Plot temporal trends by region — dmft_plot_trends
title: Plot temporal trends by region — dmft_plot_trends
text: Plot temporal trends region

title: Plot temporal trends by region — dmft_plot_trends
code: dmft_plot_trends(   estimates,   projections = NULL,   regions = NULL,   title = "DMFT Temporal Trends" )

title: Plot temporal trends by region — dmft_plot_trends
text: estimates Predictions dmft_predict(). projections Optional projections dmft_project(). regions Character vector regions plot (default: ). title Optional title.

title: Plot temporal trends by region — dmft_plot_trends
text: ggplot2::ggplot object.

what: Generate predictions from a fitted DMFT model with AST smoothing — dmft_predict
title: Generate predictions from a fitted DMFT model with AST smoothing — dmft_predict
text: Produces predictions region-year-age combinations historical period. Uses AST (Age-Spatial-Temporal) kernel smoothing mixed-model residuals, bootstrap uncertainty intervals.

title: Generate predictions from a fitted DMFT model with AST smoothing — dmft_predict
code: dmft_predict(fit, adjacency, config, n_boot = NULL)

title: Generate predictions from a fitted DMFT model with AST smoothing — dmft_predict
text: fit fitted model dmft_fit(). adjacency Adjacency object dmft_adjacency(). config dmft_config object. n_boot Number bootstrap replicates uncertainty. Set 0 skip uncertainty estimation.

title: Generate predictions from a fitted DMFT model with AST smoothing — dmft_predict
text: tibble columns: region, year, age_group, predicted, lower, upper.

what: Generate predictions from a Bayesian DMFT model with AST smoothing — dmft_predict_bayes
title: Generate predictions from a Bayesian DMFT model with AST smoothing — dmft_predict_bayes
text: Experimental Bayesian alternative dmft_predict(). Extracts posterior draws fixed random effects, computes predictions full region-year-age grid, applies AST smoothing posterior mean residuals, returns credible intervals posterior.

title: Generate predictions from a Bayesian DMFT model with AST smoothing — dmft_predict_bayes
code: dmft_predict_bayes(fit_bayes, adjacency, config)

title: Generate predictions from a Bayesian DMFT model with AST smoothing — dmft_predict_bayes
text: fit_bayes fitted Bayesian model dmft_fit_bayes(). adjacency Adjacency object dmft_adjacency(). config dmft_config object.

title: Generate predictions from a Bayesian DMFT model with AST smoothing — dmft_predict_bayes
text: tibble columns: region, year, age_group, predicted, lower, upper.

what: Project DMFT trends into the future — dmft_project
title: Project DMFT trends into the future — dmft_project
text: Extracts temporal trend fitted model generates three scenarios (reference, optimistic, pessimistic) using linear trend extrapolation optional damping bounded uncertainty.

title: Project DMFT trends into the future — dmft_project
code: dmft_project(fit, estimates, config, damping_factor = 0.95)

title: Project DMFT trends into the future — dmft_project
text: fit fitted model dmft_fit(). estimates Predictions dmft_predict(). config dmft_config object. Must projection_start projection_end set. damping_factor Trend damping per year (default 0.95).

title: Project DMFT trends into the future — dmft_project
text: tibble columns: year, scenario, mean_proj, lower, upper.

what: Project DMFT trends using Bayesian posterior draws — dmft_project_bayes
title: Project DMFT trends using Bayesian posterior draws — dmft_project_bayes
text: Experimental Bayesian alternative dmft_project(). Extracts year random effect posterior draws, estimates temporal trend, generates scenario projections uncertainty propagated posterior.

title: Project DMFT trends using Bayesian posterior draws — dmft_project_bayes
code: dmft_project_bayes(fit_bayes, estimates, config, damping_factor = 0.95)

title: Project DMFT trends using Bayesian posterior draws — dmft_project_bayes
text: fit_bayes fitted Bayesian model dmft_fit_bayes(). estimates Predictions dmft_predict_bayes(). config dmft_config object projection range set. damping_factor Trend damping per year (default 0.95).

title: Project DMFT trends using Bayesian posterior draws — dmft_project_bayes
text: tibble columns: year, scenario, mean_proj, lower, upper.

what: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
title: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
text: Orchestrates complete workflow: data loading, cleaning, spatial structure, mixed-effects model fitting, AST smoothing, bootstrap uncertainty, diagnostics, optional projections.

title: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
code: dmft_run(   data_path,   shapefile_path,   config,   dentition = c("both", "deciduous", "permanent"),   backend = c("frequentist", "bayesian"),   region_name_col = NULL,   skip_projections = FALSE )

title: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
text: data_path Path study-level CSV/XLSX data. shapefile_path Path regional shapefile. config dmft_config object. dentition dentition(s) model: "", "deciduous", "permanent". backend Modeling backend: "frequentist" (default, lme4) "bayesian" (experimental, cmdstanr). Bayesian backend requires cmdstanr, posterior, loo installed. region_name_col Column shapefile containing region names. skip_projections Skip projection step.

title: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
text: list elements config, clean_data, adjacency, fits, estimates, diagnostics, optionally projections.

title: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ cfg <- dmft_config(   regions = c("Region_A", "Region_B", "Region_C"),   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(2000, 2020),   projection_range = c(2021, 2030) ) results <- dmft_run("data.csv", "regions.shp", config = cfg) } # }
